definition: to lose one's splendor/to lose luster/to be eclipsed/to be overshadowed
(of complexion) to lose one's color/to blanch/wan

sentences.english: Eventually, the original business was eclipsed by the other holdings.
sentences.chinese: 最終，最初的這家公司與其它財產相比黯然失色。

sentences.english: The Gu way grows startled disgrace, body quickly the Zong jumped behind outside of circle.
sentences.chinese: 賈道長愕然失色，身子急忙後縱跳出了圈外。

sentences.english: Her playing pats mine in the shade.
sentences.chinese: 她的演奏使我的相形失色。

sentences.english: He seemed to relish the pressure and focus that had eclipsed his predecessors.
sentences.chinese: 安帥對壓力和聚焦的把握能力讓他的前任黯然失色。

sentences.english: The scandal he was involved in before detracts his from great glorious.
sentences.chinese: 他以往捲入的那件醜問已使他的光輝業績大爲失色。

sentences.english: The huge brick house which Banker White had built on Buckey Street had overshadowed it.
sentences.chinese: 銀行家懷特在白克埃街上建的大磚屋，使它黯然失色。

sentences.english: Although the crocodiles are dead, some female customers still paled when they saw them.
sentences.chinese: 儘管是兩條死鱷魚，但很多女顧客還是嚇得花容失色。

sentences.english: Industrial waste is despoiling the environment.
sentences.chinese: 工業廢料正在使環境失色。

sentences.english: You, you look really CSL, even goddesses in front of you must fade.
sentences.chinese: 幽先生，您長得真俊，連女神在您面前都要黯然失色。

sentences.english: In his eyes she eclipses and predominates the whole of her sex.
sentences.chinese: 在他的眼裏，她卓然不凡，使其他女性黯然失色。

sentences.english: The sight was so horrible that Laura changed colour from fear.
sentences.chinese: 這景象如此可怕，勞拉不由大驚失色。

sentences.english: Fright drained all colour from his face.
Even the David Cameron and Nick Clegg travelling roadshow has lost its zest.
sentences.chinese: 即便是卡梅隆和克萊格的巡迴演說，也黯然失色了。

sentences.english: This undercuts the whole idea of faster cellular speeds.
sentences.chinese: 這讓提高手機速度的整體創意失色不少。

sentences.english: Then the minister came, and in that overshadowing presence the lesser lights went into eclipse.
sentences.chinese: 接着牧師到了，他的華麗的在場令燈光也黯然失色。

sentences.english: When she discovered her baby had disappeared, she was greatly frantic.
sentences.chinese: 她發現孩子不見了，大驚失色。

definition: to startle/to be frightened/to be scared/alarm
overwhelmed with shock, horror or amazement/dumbstruck/aghast
to lose one's voice/(to cry out) involuntarily
to be shocked/to be appalled/to be terrified
to have a surprise (idiom); shocked or startled/gobsmacked
to be surprised/to be amazed/to be stunned
